page.title: 16Recent History-Gosmore
page.content: An interview with two elderly residents of Gosmore,Mr & Mrs Fagg, revealed the following{changes within {living memory: "The Priory Way area was a pea field on the edge of Priory Park. "Before the 2nd World War,a small cul de sac was developed and this is now the other end of Priory Way,near the letter box. "In 1948,the pea field was sold and the road laid down and from 1949 to about 1955 the houses were built. "At about the same time,Dale Close was developed and shortly afterwards,the Silent Order of Nuns who lived in a large house on the land between Dale Close and Newlands Lane was sold and the nuns moved away.This area was then also developed." (contd.)
